intro: Coris monspeliensis var. longispina, commonly known as the long-spined coris, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to southern Europe and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Its distinctive feature is the long, bristly spines that adorn the stems and leaves, providing a unique appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its architectural form and ecological value to pollinators.
